Sam, you look a little different. →

# MATT
And welcome back. →
So last we left off: Bells Hells, after a brief excursion into the Fey Realm to do some team building exercises after a bit of a fracture happened between their respective friendships before going into a recon mission to the red Moon of Ill Omen. →
# TRAVIS
(laughs) →

# MATT
You acquired some materials. →
With the help of Allura Vysoren, you returned to the Hellcatch Valley to one of the nearby resistance garrisons against the Ruby Vanguard's plot under Ludinus Da'leth to unleash the god eater Predathos that sits within that moon. →
Here, you've met with a number of powerful figures, this side of this troop. →
You were given an opportunity and a heavy distraction to sneak in from the southeastern side of the excavation site. →
After being dropped off by Keyleth of the Air Ashari, her summoning a massive storm to give even more challenging power to the distraction that surrounds this site, you all begin to slink in under cover of magical shadow and disguises to appear like members of the Vanguard. →
You push through the dense sandstorm, the sounds of conflict, explosions, shouts and bestial war cries echoing from the other side of the massive pit. →
You approach the outskirts. →
Here you can see from where you stand, the shapes of where the cliff begins to reveal the edge of the excavation site. →
You see massive ballista now embedded into the side that weren't there previously, a number of tents set up for individuals that are keeping watch. →
Though you do not see immediately any signs of other figures other than the large, slowly lumbering Vanguard Warder that is (heavy thudding) peeking around while the majority of the defenses are shifting focus onto the other side of the site. →
What are you doing? →

You can hear the still mounting swells of combat above that echo and shift and morph at this distance into this constant swishing sound of din that blends with the storm above. →
That red light of the bridge above, you begin to step in towards the center of what you hope to be your destination here, and onward towards the moon. →

# TALIESIN
Delve into a new tabletop roleplaying game of investigative horror with the "Candela Obscura Core Rulebook" using the Illuminated Worlds System by Darrington Press. →
Roam the turn-of-the-century- inspired setting of the Fairelands, including the bustling city of Newfaire and the ancient ruins of Oldfaire below. →
Assemble a circle of investigators within the paranormal secret society of Candela Obscura. →
You'll analyze strange and horrifying events, fight back against dangerous phenomena, and contain the bleed that spreads from corruptive magick. →
Choose from 10 custom character sheets to empower your investigations and explorations. →
Use tactical intuition and brawn with the Soldier specialty, use your charm with finesse and flair as the Magician specialty, or study and practice mystical arts as an Occultist. →
Explore districts of Newfaire, competing organizations, four full assignments, and dozens of example assignments to inspire you. →
If you choose to brave the role of Game Master, this guide contains everything needed to pave the way for your Candela Obscura investigators. →
Offered in both a standard edition as well as an ornate limited edition for collectors, the "Candela Obscura Core Rulebook" contains 204 art-filled pages, including maps, items, immersive notes, mysteries, and plenty more to power your very own story. →
Keep this tome close for the knowledge obtained may be the key to protecting you, your allies, and the Fairelands. →
Hey Critters! Laura Bailey here to guide you through what's new in the Critical Role shop. →
Can you put donuts in this? Only one way to find out. →
It's too powerful. →
This is pretty badass. →
It's the little things in life. →
Style should never be a dump stat, darling. →
Look at this. Isn't is fashion? So much fashion happening here. →
Oooh, so comfy cozy. →
This is a lot of stuff, you guys. →
We have so many cool things right now. →
And hey if you want, you could head over to the Critical Role shop right now. →
A dark bargain is struck from a place of anguish, and a wandering innocence aims to even the score, losing itself in the process. →
Curfew now falls on the streets of Groundswell as the Periphery aim to snuff out a local uprising. →
And though it's true that many assignments have violent beginnings, violent ends rarely bring a satisfying resolution. →
A wise investigator knows when it's best to sheathe the blade and bear the heart. →
The Circle of Tide and Bone. →
Assignment Number 37-13: Guardian of Groundswell. →
♪ (tense mysterious music) ♪ ♪ (tense mysterious music) ♪ ♪ (tense mysterious music) ♪ (ominous music) Hi. We're the narrators of Midst. →
What's Midst? It's very simple. →
It's a weird surrealist fourth wall breaking reality bending science, fantasy space western about a small, doomed planet floating in a cosmic ocean of spooky darkness. →
Upon whose alien landscape an ensemble cast of characters, including a crotchety outlaw, a freakishly virtuous cultist and a diabolical businessman, make awful decisions and fight like hell to survive when the moon falls out of the sky and a large number of terrible things happened in rapid succession. →
It's exciting, it's funny, it's scary. →
It's got neat sound, weird music, amazing visuals, and every episode comes with bonus content you can read and examine. →
Midst is performed solely by yours truly. →
As the three of us narrate all the action, play all of the characters, and bend a lot of the rules about how telling stories is normally supposed to work. →
Midst is pretty fun, very strange, and it feels like VR for your brain. →
We believe you'll enjoy it. →
Or maybe you won't, but there's really only one way to find out. →
You're going to have to listen to Midst. →
(epic music) (mischievous music) (typewriter clacking) (peaceful music) →

When the forces of evil threaten Exandria, these heroes are there to answer the call. →

About this time, you notice at first, Orym, but there is a (fluttery wisps) flutter of energy that is cascading down the bridge, before there's a flash. →
At the top of the steps, you see as two figures, three figures, four figures emerge. →
You see one of them appears to be a Reiloran with that massive headdress of chains and long flowing multi-part cloaks. →
It doesn't even touch the ground. →
It just floats in the air and glides around as it stands there. →
It looks like itself is manipulating the world and gravity around it, as it takes in this space around it. →
Second one that emerges looks to be a Vanguard figure of somewhat elevated stature. →
You see a mantle that stretches with wider shoulders. →
There are strips of material that have language written upon them that dangle just past the mid-waist figure with, it's a tall, thin, almost elvish figure with long ears. →
You can't make out details this far away. →
One looks like a soldier that begins to descend to the steps. →
Another one that you see with a thick cloak mantle that flows around tight leather armor with sheathed weapons and shortish gray hair, as you see Otohan Thull steps through. →
In that brief moment of stillness, you see as she steps out, looks up in the air, "Maintain the perimeter and double siege defenses! Foot soldiers regroup and do not abandon the Key!" →
# LAURA

# MATT
"Fools!" # TALIESIN
That's fair. →
# MATT
I've let this turn stretch quite a bit. →
# TALIESIN
That's fair. →
# MATT
So I'll say that's about where we get. →
# ASHLEY
I was going to put the possum in my bag on my turn. →
Can I grab the possum before I'm thrown into the Bloody Bridge, not that I need it. →
# MATT
Your turn was in a few rounds. →
# LAURA
Yeah, your turn is next. →
# MATT
I'll tell you what. →
Roll a dexterity check for me. →
# SAM
It's a bad guy. →
You'd be taking a bad guy with us. →
# ASHLEY
I know! Well, I don't know! Don't we have to put it in the bag? →
# MATT
Because here's the thing-- →
# ASHLEY
I don't have to put it in the stupid bag. →
# MATT
No, no, no, it's okay. →
I'm saying because it doesn't want to be grabbed and you're trying to grab it, it's you contested against this possum. →
# ASHLEY
Come here! →
# MATT
It's going to be a plus two to its roll. →
# ASHLEY
(laughs) No. →
# MATT
(laughs) →
# ASHLEY
Slippery little thing! →
# MATT
You reach for it, and it bites your hand. →
You're like, "Fuck!" →
# ASHLEY
Ow! →
# MATT
It rolled an 18. →
# LAURA
You shit! →
# MATT
It was a natural 16. →
# ASHLEY
Fuck off! →
# MATT
(snarling) It hisses at you. →
# ASHLEY
Ah! (furry poof) (laughter) →
# LAURA
My hand! →
# MATT
Before you vanish up into the bridge. →
With that, that brings us to-- →
# LAURA
Oh no. →
# SAM
Y'all are going to be okay. →
# MATT
The possum vanishes. →
(surprised yells) →
# MARISHA
Oh shit! Oh shit! (laughter) →
# TRAVIS

# MATT
Yeah, it's going after her. →
# LAURA

# MATT

# TALIESIN

# MATT

# MATT

# TALIESIN

# MATT

This one here is going to attempt to push this ruin over onto the device that you're running. →

# MARISHA

I need you to make a dexterity saving throw for me. →
# MARISHA

# TRAVIS

# TALIESIN
I had to leave. →

# TRAVIS

# MATT

# LAURA

# MATT

# TRAVIS

# LAURA

# SAM

# MATT

# ASHLEY
Cool. →
# MATT
Okay. →
# SAM
We have one of those? →
# MATT
You pull the scroll out. →
# LAURA
Uh-huh. →
# MATT
You begin muttering the incantation, and as you glance up past the edge of the scroll as you finish the final phrase, you can see the Thought Eater, that stare bearing down on you. →
In your mind, you hear, "We'll come and we'll find you. →
I would like to taste what's in that mind." →
# LAURA
I'm going to kill you and all your friends. →
# MARISHA
Villain arc. →
(vanishing whoosh) →
# MATT
You both vanish, teleporting into the base of the bridge? →
# LAURA
Right at the edge, yeah. →
# MATT
As you both appear, you both appear, and it looks like you're about to fall, but you continue to drift slowly up arm in arm as you both look at each other and look up at the ever intense, glowing, bright red, shaking energy, before-- →
# LAURA
♪ We're off to see the wi-- ♪ (yells) →
# MATT
(magical thrust) →
All of you, in your journeys, being thrust through this massive beam of alien energy, you don't see anything but red, bright, sun-like light. →
It's blinding, and the sense of being pulled at an incredible speed, you fear if you were to hit a wall, you would just become atoms. →
Within just moments, it's gone. →
Here, as you stand suddenly, the red light filtering behind you, your eyes come to focus, and you can see the structure that's built around you, the returning point of the Malleus Key. →
Walls and boundaries, barricades built around it. →
You can see this red plant growth that filters through the gray and red rock. →
There's a little cluster here of Exandrian stone that builds into the red and ruddy shale that sits around it. →
You can see the dusty plumes of red storms that swirl on the horizon, and just beyond them, above, you can see the endless sea of stars and the entirety of Exandria there, consuming a quarter of the sky above you. →
And that's where we're going to end tonight's episode. →
